intro: Monechma floridum, commonly known as Florida monechma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces slender, branching stems that bear the inflorescence. Monechma floridum is an important species for local biodiversity and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
